primary.context: The caller wants to get rid of their timeshare property.
primary.detail: The caller requested a representative for an out-of-scope task, but the transfer failed due to queue unavailability, leading the caller to hang up.

steps: Agent attempted to gather intent before transferring.
Caller stated they wanted to 'sell time shift'.
Agent correctly identified this as out-of-scope but entered a clarification loop regarding 'renting' vs 'selling'.
Agent initiated transfer to concierge department.
Caller waited in queue for approximately 25 minutes.
Queue returned the caller to the AI agent because no representatives were available.
Caller abandoned after being told waiting would not work.

failure.detail: Agent persisted in clarifying 'renting' vs 'selling' after the user explicitly stated they wanted to sell ownership entirely.

clarifications.note: Asking if user wants to sell outright

corrections.note: User denies agent's specific phrasing of selling

loops.subject: selling vs renting
loops.note: Agent repeatedly asks about renting despite user's 'sell' intent

actions.detail: Transferred to concierge; queue timed out after 25 mins

insights.summary: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare ownership. The AI agent struggled to confirm the intent despite the caller being relatively clear, and the subsequent transfer to a human agent failed because no one was available after a 25-minute wait.
insights.verbatim: There are no representatives available to take your call right now, so waiting will not connect you with someone.
insights.coaching: The agent should have proceeded to transfer as soon as the user confirmed 'ownership entirely' in Turn 12, rather than looping back to ask about renting in Turn 13.
